channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: WHO chief, his voice trembling, says top threat 'is not the virus itself'
'Very unlikely' world can eradicate or eliminate coronavirus in current situation, WHO says
Trump says doctors called the results of his cognitive test 'unbelievable'
item.description: CNN's Alisyn Camerota speaks with former Trump Organization Executive Vice President Barbara Res and CNN Commentator Michael D'Antonio about President Trump's claim on Fox News that he recently took a cognitive test and the results surprised his doctors.

item.title: Merkel inserts a dagger into populists' 'denial of basic truths'
item.description: Angela Merkel may not scream down the phone at President Donald Trump -- but she knows how to insert a dagger.

item.title: Trump continues to ignore pandemic with another trip to a hotspot
More evidence emerges that a TB vaccine might help fight coronavirus
item.description: More research emerged this week in potential support of using the tuberculosis vaccine Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) as a tool in the fight against coronavirus.

item.title: Covid-19 symptoms: What we know now and what to do
item.description: It may feel like years, but the world has only been battling the deadly novel coronavirus for months. As scientists feverishly work around the clock to unravel the mysteries of this deadly invader, they have gained interesting insights into the virus and the disease it causes: Covid-19.

item.title: Doctor calls out White House for running misinformation campaign
item.description: Dean for the National School of Tropical Medicine Dr. Peter Hotez speaks with CNN's John Berman and Alisyn Camerota about the current state of the coronavirus in our nation, and what he perceives as a misinformation campaign by the Whtte House.

item.title: Amazon tells employees to remove TikTok immediately -- then takes it back
item.description: Amazon has instructed its employees to remove the short-video app TikTok from their devices immediately, according to a person familiar with the matter.

item.title: The Russian whistleblower risking it all to expose the scale of an Arctic oil spill catastrophe
The 38 most bizarre quotes from Trump's new 'interview' with Sean Hannity
item.description: Faced with coronavirus surges in some of the largest states in the country and a public turning dramatically against how he has responded to the crisis, President Donald Trump spent 40 minutes of his Thursday night on the phone with Fox News host Sean Hannity.

item.title: 'Never Trump' movement returns for Act II, armed with President's own words and record
item.description: The Never Trump movement failed four years ago. But a small band of Republicans still bucking their party are back with a new game plan for their second act: turning President Donald Trump's words and record against him.

item.title: Japan is going to build one of the world's most sophisticated stealth jet fighters
item.description: Japan has announced plans to build one of the world's most sophisticated stealth jet fighters, likely a twin-engine aircraft designed to take over the country's critical air defense role sometime in the next decade.

item.title: Erdogan orders conversion of Roman Empire's first Christian cathedral back into mosque
item.description: A court in Turkey has announced that it has ruled in favor of a government-backed proposal to turn the city's famous Hagia Sophia museum back into a mosque.

item.title: Kazakhstan denies Chinese claim of 'unknown pneumonia' outbreak more deadly than Covid-19
item.description: A new "unknown pneumonia" that is potentially deadlier than the novel coronavirus has reportedly killed more than 1,700 people this year in the Central Asian country of Kazakhstan, according to a warning issued by Chinese officials Thursday.

item.title: Goya CEO tells Fox he won't apologize after his praise for Trump sparks boycott
item.description: In an interview with Fox News Friday, Goya Foods CEO Robert Unanue said he was "not apologizing" for praising President Donald Trump at the White House.

item.title: Republican says he'd rather vote for a 'tuna fish sandwich' over Trump
item.description: Ads aren't unusual for an election year, but as CNN's Jeff Zeleny reports, Republican "Never Trump" groups are spending millions hoping to make the leader of their party a one-term president.

item.title: Imagine being forced to live with your boss. That's the case for nearly 400,000 women in Hong Kong
item.description: When Marta came to Hong Kong in 2011, she was a 29-year-old single mother, looking for a job that could support her young daughter and sick father back in the Philippines.

item.title: What we know about 'Glee' actress Naya Rivera's disappearance
item.description: The search for the body of "Glee" actress Naya Rivera is set to resume Friday after she went missing from a lake in Southern California.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell argues for bail, says she's 'not Jeffrey Epstein'
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell, the confidant of accused sex-trafficker Jeffrey Epstein, argued in a court filing Friday that she should be granted bail while awaiting trial, claiming she wasn't in "hiding" while under criminal investigation, as prosecutors allege, and hasn't left the country in more than a year.

item.title: Woman soldier joining elite Green Berets unit for the first time
item.description: A woman soldier for the first time will join the Green Berets, one of the Army's most elite units, after graduating this week from US Army Special Forces training.

item.title: Trump ally stirs up anti-gay sentiment in reelection bid
item.description: Poland's President Andrzej Duda is one of President Trump's biggest allies in Europe and is fighting for political survival. His campaign has been laced with anti-LGBT rhetoric and the election is seen as a referendum on Trump-style populism in Europe. CNN's Frederik Pleitgen reports.

item.title: Dozens of Mississippi lawmakers have coronavirus after weeks of refusing to wear masks
item.description: If you've been in contact with your state lawmaker in Mississippi, you may want to get a coronavirus test.

item.title: Man cuts through fence to escape Covid-19 quarantine and visit liquor store
item.description: A man in his 50s absconded from a New Zealand coronavirus quarantine facility, cutting through a fence to visit a liquor store, officials revealed on Friday.

item.title: Watch Trump react to Supreme Court's ruling on his taxes
item.description: President Donald Trump lashed out after the Supreme Court ruled that the President is not immune from a New York prosecutor's subpoena for his tax return.

item.title: Jada Pinkett Smith and Will Smith confirm her involvement with August Alsina
item.description: Jada Pinkett Smith and Will Smith "never ever thought that we would make it back."

item.title: Why the 'Chinese Matisse' is setting the art market alight
item.description: A nude painting by Sanyu, hailed as the "Chinese Matisse," sold for over 258 million Hong Kong dollars ($33.3 million) at auction this week, confirming his status as one of the most sought-after names in the lucrative Asian art market.

item.title: Watchdogs sound alarm after major Philippines broadcaster denied new license
item.description: Lawmakers in the Philippines have voted against granting a new license to one of the country's largest and most influential broadcasting networks, a move that critics say will undermine press freedom.

item.title: CNN anchor: If I sound frustrated, it's because I am
item.description: CNN's Erin Burnett discusses the latest coronavirus numbers as the United States reaches the highest seven-day average of cases since the start of the pandemic.

item.title: Elon Musk about to get another $1.8 billion payday from Tesla
item.description: At the end of May Tesla granted CEO Elon Musk stock options worth $1.8 billion today. Now, it's about to that again -- for a second time in just over two months.

item.title: Black Lives Matter mural painted outside Trump Tower on Fifth Avenue
item.description: New York City painted a Black Lives Matter mural on Fifth Avenue right outside of Trump Tower.

item.title: Eminem slams people who refuse to wear masks in new song
item.description: Kid Cudi and Eminem released their first collaboration on Friday titled "The Adventures of Moon Man & Slim Shady." The song touches on a number of topics, from people refusing to wear masks to police brutality.

item.title: CNN goes inside hospital on US-Mexico border
item.description: CNN's Kyung Lah goes inside a hospital near the US-Mexico border overwhelmed with coronavirus cases as the state records it's deadliest day since the start of the pandemic.

item.title: Instagram bans all content promoting conversion therapy
item.description: Instagram will ban any content that promotes conversion therapy, the social media platform told CNN on Friday, after activists called on it to block providers from advertising their services online.

item.title: Sprinter celebrates breaking 200m world record -- only to find out he was 15m short
item.description: Former middle distance runner turned athletics commentator Steve Cram was flummoxed and flabbergasted as US sprinter Noah Lyles crossed the finishing line.

item.title: We asked Black artists from Mississippi to design a new state flag
item.description: What should Mississippi's new state flag look like? Voters in November will have the chance to choose a design that best represents the identity of the Magnolia state, following the retirement of their state flag.

item.title: A secretive and controversial startup may go public. Here's what you should know about it
item.description: In the 17 years since it was founded, Palantir Technologies has received financial backing from the CIA, become one of the most valuable private companies in the US, and earned a seat at the table alongside the biggest tech companies in meeting with President Donald Trump.

item.title: Hong Kong was a 'safe harbor' for tech companies shut out of China. Not anymore
item.description: For decades, Silicon Valley giants shut out of China by the country's massive censorship apparatus have continued to operate in Hong Kong thanks to the city's unique political status that guaranteed it a free internet.

item.title: What it's like to vacation in Florida right now
item.description: Florida, as usual, has been making headlines, as coronavirus cases across the state spike as angrily as the summer heat. But even in raging pandemic times, there's still no putting a state this diverse in a box.

item.title: Internet goes wild searching for #SATGUY
item.description: Internet sleuths try to score the name of the guy who allegedly took Trump's SATs for him. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

item.title: What happens when cruise ships retire
item.description: Hundreds of cruise ships usually traverse the world's waters, but right now -- with the cruise industry on an indefinite hold due to the coronavirus pandemic -- they're mostly laid up at sea with no passengers.

item.title: Theme park reopens with strange new rule
item.description: A theme park in Fujiyoshida, Japan, is banning screaming on its roller coasters to prevent the spread of Covid-19 and instead is urging customers to "scream in their hearts."

item.title: This comic sensation is wowing Instagram users with her skits on Nigerian families
item.description: In April 2019, a Nigerian comedian uploaded a skit to Instagram that showed a mother rushing to get her daughter to school. The daughter had overslept and missed the school bus.

item.title: 'Pleading' from aides led to Trump finally agreeing to wear a mask
item.description: As coronavirus cases surged in the Sun Belt in recent weeks, one Republican leader after another has come forward to publicly endorse face masks -- and model the practice themselves -- in an attempt to depoliticize their use as a public health precaution.

item.title: Trump continues to ignore pandemic during trip to Florida hotspot
item.description: President Donald Trump's trip to Florida on Friday would seem like any other presidential visit to a swing state a few months before an election if the United States was not in the middle of a pandemic and the Sunshine State not its latest hotspot.

item.title: Cooper to CDC director: Is the CDC caving to Trump?
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper asks CDC Director Dr. Robert Redfield about President Trump trashing the agency's guidance for reopening schools.

item.title: Pathologist's remarkable discovery during Covid-19 autopsies
item.description: Covid-19 symptoms: What we know now

item.title: This may be the worst ecological catastrophe in the polar Arctic
Facebook weighing ban on political ads in days before US election
item.description: Facebook is considering banning political advertising on its platform in the days leading up to the US presidential election in November, a person familiar with the discussions told CNN. The potential ban has been under consideration since last fall, the person said.
